My internship abroad in Estonia

Arrival in Estonia

Finally the day arrvied, everything is packed, I arrive early enough, a last goodbye to my loved ones and...
My flight has a delay.
But after I listened to some music for thirty more minutes, the plane was ready to be boarded.

After two further hours I left my homeland 1000km behind me and stood in Estonia's capital.
I tried not to waste too much time, after all it was 20:00 o'clock and Kairi, the person responsible for me during my time in Estonia, was waiting for me outside.
She greeted me warmly and in the car we talked about the city, pending matters for me and my German roomate Stephan and further plans for the week.

After we arrived at the apartment and Stephan and me greet each other we were left alone.
Pressed by hunger and curiosity I was eager to leave the apartment and go on a small expedition in the old town, concluding my day in Berlin fashion with a Kebab.



Sunday, June 25th


Why Estonia?

Due to startup-friendly regulations Estonia has built up a reputation for beeing a good place to create a company.
Over the years many new small and innovative companies were founded in Estonia and today it hosts the most startups per capita in Europe.

This is helped by the fact, that you are able to become an e-citizen by signing in online on the official Estonian website.
Doing taxes, booking an doctors appointment or identifying yourself is beeing streamlined and digitalized.
All of this leads to a sentiment of optimism, change and witnessing the formation of a new modern society.

Furthermore it is the farthest north I have ever been.
Even though I planned on visiting Sweden I am very happy with my choice.
The country has enough beautifull nature to offer and Tallinn is an interesting city.
Should I be bored with the capital, Riga in Latvia and Helsinki in Finnaland are up to a four hours drive away.
